description: High-level view of Docker container health and resource usage on the main homelab node. Uses cAdvisor metrics to track CPU, memory, disk, network and container uptime, grouped by stack and by container.

panels.description: Health check for the cAdvisor exporter. If this is DOWN, container-level metrics in this dashboard are stale or missing and the rest of the panels should not be trusted.
panels.title: cAdvisor exporter status

panels.description: Approximate number of Docker containers seen by cAdvisor in the last 5 minutes. Sudden drops usually mean crashed services or stacks being stopped; spikes typically correspond to deployments or batch jobs.
panels.title: Running containers

panels.description: Share of total host CPU time currently consumed by all Docker containers, averaged over the last 5 minutes. High sustained values near the red threshold indicate CPU saturation and little headroom for additional workloads.
panels.title: Containers CPU vs host

panels.description: Share of host RAM currently used by Docker containers compared to the node’s total physical memory. Values close to the red threshold leave little room for the OS page cache and other processes, and may lead to swapping or OOM kills.
panels.title: Containers memory vs host

panels.description: Per-stack CPU usage as a percentage of total host CPU, grouped by Docker Compose project and averaged over the last 5 minutes. Use this panel to see which stacks are driving overall container CPU usage.
panels.title: CPU by stack

panels.description: Top Docker containers by share of host CPU over the last 5 minutes. Helps identify which specific services are currently the main CPU consumers inside each stack.
panels.title: Top containers – CPU

panels.description: Per-stack container memory usage (working set), aggregated across all containers in each Docker Compose project and shown in MiB/GiB. Use it to spot stacks that are steadily growing in memory or close to their expected limits.
panels.title: Memory by stack

panels.description: Docker containers with the highest working set memory usage. Highlights services that are consuming a large share of RAM and may need closer monitoring or tuning.
panels.title: Top containers – memory

panels.description: Aggregated disk read and write throughput per Docker Compose project, based on cAdvisor container filesystem metrics over the last 5 minutes. Spikes highlight which stacks are stressing the underlying disks.
panels.title: Disk I/O by stack

panels.description: Top Docker containers by combined read and write disk throughput over the last 5 minutes. Use this table to pinpoint services that are hammering the disk and may explain high latency or noisy neighbours.
panels.title: Top containers – disk I/O

panels.description: Aggregated network receive and transmit throughput per Docker Compose project, calculated from cAdvisor metrics over the last 5 minutes. Shows which stacks are responsible for most of the network traffic on the node.
panels.title: Network by stack

panels.description: Top Docker containers by combined receive and transmit network throughput over the last 5 minutes. Helps identify chatty services, bandwidth-heavy workloads or unexpected outbound traffic.
panels.title: Top containers – network

panels.description: Containers whose uptime is below 1 hour, derived from cAdvisor start timestamps. Useful to spot frequent restarts, recent deployments or unstable services at a glance.
panels.title: Recent container starts

panels.description: Current uptime for all containers scraped by cAdvisor, shown as a point-in-time view. Use it together with the “Recent container starts” panel to distinguish long-running services from containers that are being restarted often.
panels.title: Container uptime snapshot

panels.description:
CPU usage for the selected container as a share of host CPU, using a 5-minute moving average.
Use this panel to inspect short-term spikes and confirm whether a container is actually busy
when it appears in the “Top containers – CPU” table.
panels.title: CPU – $stack / $service / $container

panels.description:
Working set memory for the selected container over time, shown in MiB/GiB.
Helps track growth, spot sudden jumps and detect potential memory leaks or mis-sized limits.
panels.title: Memory  – $stack / $service / $container

panels.description:
Combined read and write disk throughput for the selected container, based on cAdvisor filesystem
metrics and calculated over a 5-minute window. Use it to see whether this service is responsible
for disk spikes observed at stack level.
panels.title: Disk I/O – $stack / $service / $container

panels.description:
Combined receive and transmit network throughput for the selected container over time.
Helps confirm whether a service is causing network bursts, sustained bandwidth usage,
or unusual outbound traffic.
panels.title: Network  – $stack / $service / $container

list.description: Docker Compose project (stack) discovered by cAdvisor.
list.label: stack
list.name: stack

list.description: Docker Compose service within the selected stack.
list.label: service
list.name: service

list.description: Container name within the selected stack and service.
list.label: container
list.name: container

title: Containers – Docker overview
